intro: Lingoum villosum, commonly known as the hairy tassel plant, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value is due to its delicate foliage and unique floral structure.
